description: Some nontrivial permutation of digits gives an even number.
comments: Also: Even numbers with more than 2 digits (so you can swap any two digits other than the last one), or numbers having at least one even digit not in the last position (so you can swap that one with the last digit). - M. F. Hasler, Sep 30 2012
formula: a(n) ~ n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 19 2012
example: 22 is a term since the permutation that swaps the first and second digits gives an even number. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 30 2012
prog: (PARI) is_A007930(n)={!bittest(n, 0) & n>99 || while(n\=10, bittest(n, 0) || return(1))} \\ -  M. F. Hasler, Sep 30 2012
author: R. Muller
